snippet: The Pentagon called the release of the prison’s last three Uighur detainees, originally from China and captured in Afghanistan, a “significant milestone.”
abstract: Military announces that United States has transferred three Chinese detainees from prison in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, to Slovakia; Pentagon calls it 'significant milestone' in effort to close prison; three are the last of 22 ethnic Uighurs from China who were captured after the American invasion of Afghanistan in 2001.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon called the release of the prison’s last three Uighur detainees, originally from China and captured in Afghanistan, a “significant milestone.”

headline.main: U.S. Frees Last of the Chinese Uighur Detainees From Guantánamo Bay
headline.print_headline: U.S. Frees Last of the Chinese Uighur Detainees From Guantánamo Bay

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
